df-recs
blocks.content: Define a function ` recs ( F ) ` on ` On ` , the class of ordinal numbers, by transfinite recursion given a rule ` F ` which sets the next value given all values so far. See ~ df-rdg for more details on why this definition is desirable. Unlike ~ df-rdg which restricts the update rule to use only the previous value, this version allows the update rule to use _all_ previous values, which is why it is described as "strong", although it is actually more primitive. See ~ recsfnon and ~ recsval for the primary contract of this definition. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 18-Jan-2015.) (Revised by Scott Fenton, 3-Aug-2020.)

blocks.name: dfrecs3
blocks.content: The old definition of transfinite recursion. This version is preferred for development, as it demonstrates the properties of transfinite recursion without relying on well-founded recursion. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 3-Aug-2020.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: tfrlem1
blocks.content: A technical lemma for transfinite recursion. Compare Lemma 1 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 47. (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-1995.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-May-2019.)
blocks.origin:

  |- wi(w0, wral(s0, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c2, cv(s0)))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, con0))
  -| wi(w0, wa(wfun(c1), wss(c0, cdm(c1))))
  -| wi(w0, wa(wfun(c2), wss(c0, cdm(c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, c0, wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, cres(c1, cv(s0))))))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, c0, wceq(cfv(c2, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, cres(c2, cv(s0))))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {

blocks.name: tfrlem3a
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. Let ` A ` be the class of "acceptable" functions. The final thing we're interested in is the union of all these acceptable functions. This lemma just changes some bound variables in ` A ` for later use. (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-1995.)
blocks.origin:
thm tfrlem3a(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wb(wcel(c0, c1), wrex(s0, con0, wa(wfn(c0, cv(s0)), wral(s1, cv(s0), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cres(c0, cv(s1))))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cab(s2, wrex(s3, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s2), cv(s3)), wral(s4, cv(s3), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(s2), cv(s4)))))))))
  -| wcel(c0, universe)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)

  -| diffsc(s4, c0)
  -| diffsc(s4, c2)
} = {
  elab2(s2, c0, c1, wrex(s0, con0, wa(wfn(c0, cv(s0)), wral(s1, cv(s0), wceq(cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c2, cres(c0, cv(s1))))))), wrex(s3, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s2), cv(s3)), wral(s4, cv(s3), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)), cfv(c2, cres(cv(s2), cv(s4))))))))

blocks.name: tfrlem3
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. Let ` A ` be the class of "acceptable" functions. The final thing we're interested in is the union of all these acceptable functions. This lemma just changes some bound variables in ` A ` for later use. (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-1995.)
blocks.origin:
thm tfrlem3(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(c0, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))))
  -| wceq(c0, cab(s3, wrex(s4, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s3), cv(s4)), wral(s5, cv(s4), wceq(cfv(cv(s3), cv(s5)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s3), cv(s5)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s3, c1)
  -| diffsc(s4, c1)
  -| diffsc(s5, c1)
} = {
  a1ii(wceq(c0, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2))))))))), diffsc(s0, c1))
  abbi2i(s0, c0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2))))))))
  tfrlem3a(s1, s2, s3, s4, s5, cv(s0), c0, c1)
  vex(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s2, s0)
  diffss.ex(s2, s0)

  diffss.ex(s3, s0)
  diff.cv.s(s4, s0)

  diff.cv.s(s5, s0)
  diffss.ex(s5, s0)

blocks.name: tfrlem4
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. ` A ` is the class of all "acceptable" functions, and ` F ` is their union. First we show that an acceptable function is in fact a function. (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-1995.)
blocks.origin:
thm tfrlem4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wfun(cv(s0)))
  -| wceq(c0, cab(s1, wrex(s2, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wral(s3, cv(s2), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s1), cv(s3)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s3, c1)
} = {
  sylbi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wfun(cv(s0)), wrex(hs0, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s0), cv(hs1))))))))
  abeq2i(s0, c0, wrex(hs0, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s0), cv(hs1))))))))
  tfrlem3(s0, hs0, hs1, s1, s2, s3, c0, c1)
  rexlimivw(hs0, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s0), cv(hs1)))))), wfun(cv(s0)))
  adantr(wfn(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s0), cv(hs1))))), wfun(cv(s0)))
  fnfun(cv(s0), cv(hs0))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)

  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wi(wa(wbr(cv(s2), cv(s0), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s2), cv(s1), cv(s4))), wceq(cv(s3), cv(s4)))), diffss(s0, s1))

blocks.name: recsfval
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. The definition ` recs ` is the union of all acceptable functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm recsfval(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(crecs(c0), cuni(c1))
  -| wceq(c1, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c0, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
} = {
  eqtr4i(crecs(c0), cuni(c1), cuni(cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c0, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2))))))))))
  dfrecs3(s0, s1, s2, c0)
  unieqi(c1, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c0, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))))
}

blocks.name: tfrlem6
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. The union of all acceptable functions is a relation. (Contributed by NM, 8-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm tfrlem6(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wrel(crecs(c0))
  -| wceq(c1, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c0, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
} = {
  mpbir(wrel(crecs(c0)), wrel(cuni(c1)))
  mprgbir(hs0, c1, wrel(cuni(c1)), wrel(cv(hs0)))
  reluni(hs0, c1)
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wrel(cv(hs0)), wfun(cv(hs0)))
  tfrlem4(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c1, c0)
  funrel(cv(hs0))
  releqi(crecs(c0), cuni(c1))
  recsfval(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

thm tfrlem6(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ Rel(recs(c0))
  ⊣ c1 = { s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ On,(s0[Fn]s1 ∧ ∀(s2 ∈ s1,(s0 ` s2)=(c0 `(s0 |` s2)))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
} = {
  mpbir(Rel(recs(c0)), Rel(⋃ c1))
  mprgbir(hs0, c1, Rel(⋃ c1), Rel(hs0))
  reluni(hs0, c1)
  syl(hs0 ∈ c1, Rel(hs0), Fun(hs0))
  tfrlem4(hs0, s0, s1, s2, c1, c0)
  funrel(hs0)
  releqi(recs(c0), ⋃ c1)
  recsfval(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

thm tfrlem7(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {

  bitr4i(wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), crecs(c0)), wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), crecs(c0))), wex(hs2, wex(hs3, wa(wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cv(hs2), c1)), wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs3), c1))))), wa(wex(hs2, wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cv(hs2), c1))), wex(hs3, wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs3), c1)))))
  anbi12i(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), crecs(c0)), wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), crecs(c0)), wex(hs2, wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cv(hs2), c1))), wex(hs3, wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs3), c1))))
  bitri(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), crecs(c0)), wex(hs2, wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cv(hs2), c1))), wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cuni(c1)))
  eleq2i(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), crecs(c0), cuni(c1))
  eluni(hs2, cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), c1)
  bitri(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), crecs(c0)), wex(hs3, wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs3), c1))), wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cuni(c1)))
  eleq2i(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), crecs(c0), cuni(c1))
  recsfval(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  eluni(hs3, cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), c1)
  exdistrv(hs2, hs3, wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cv(hs2), c1)), wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs3), c1)))
  exlimivv(hs2, hs3, wa(wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cv(hs2), c1)), wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs3), c1))), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  an4s(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cv(hs2), c1), wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3)), wcel(cv(hs3), c1), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  sylanbr(wa(wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3))), wa(wcel(cv(hs2), c1), wcel(cv(hs3), c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs3), cv(hs1))))
  anbi12i(wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(s1), cv(hs3), cv(hs1)), wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs0)), cv(hs2)), wcel(cop(cv(s1), cv(hs1)), cv(hs3)))
  df-br(cv(s1), cv(hs2), cv(hs0))

thm tfrlem7(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ Fun(recs(c0))
  ⊣ c1 = { s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ On,(s0[Fn]s1 ∧ ∀(s2 ∈ s1,(s0 ` s2)=(c0 `(s0 |` s2)))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
} = {
  mpbir2an(Fun(recs(c0)), Rel(recs(c0)), ∀(s1, ∀(hs0, ∀(hs1,((< s1, hs0 > ∈ recs(c0)∧ < s1, hs1 > ∈ recs(c0))→ hs0 = hs1)))))
  tfrlem6(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  gen2(s1, hs0, ∀(hs1,((< s1, hs0 > ∈ recs(c0)∧ < s1, hs1 > ∈ recs(c0))→ hs0 = hs1)))
  ax-gen(hs1, ((< s1, hs0 > ∈ recs(c0)∧ < s1, hs1 > ∈ recs(c0))→ hs0 = hs1))
  sylbi((< s1, hs0 > ∈ recs(c0)∧ < s1, hs1 > ∈ recs(c0)), hs0 = hs1, ∃(hs2, ∃(hs3,((< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2 ∧ hs2 ∈ c1)∧(< s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3 ∧ hs3 ∈ c1)))))
  bitr4i((< s1, hs0 > ∈ recs(c0)∧ < s1, hs1 > ∈ recs(c0)), ∃(hs2, ∃(hs3,((< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2 ∧ hs2 ∈ c1)∧(< s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3 ∧ hs3 ∈ c1)))), (∃(hs2,(< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2 ∧ hs2 ∈ c1))∧ ∃(hs3,(< s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3 ∧ hs3 ∈ c1))))
  anbi12i(< s1, hs0 > ∈ recs(c0), < s1, hs1 > ∈ recs(c0), ∃(hs2,(< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2 ∧ hs2 ∈ c1)), ∃(hs3,(< s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3 ∧ hs3 ∈ c1)))
  bitri(< s1, hs0 > ∈ recs(c0), ∃(hs2,(< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2 ∧ hs2 ∈ c1)), < s1, hs0 > ∈ ⋃ c1)
  eleq2i(< s1, hs0 >, recs(c0), ⋃ c1)
  eluni(hs2, < s1, hs0 >, c1)
  bitri(< s1, hs1 > ∈ recs(c0), ∃(hs3,(< s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3 ∧ hs3 ∈ c1)), < s1, hs1 > ∈ ⋃ c1)
  eleq2i(< s1, hs1 >, recs(c0), ⋃ c1)

  eluni(hs3, < s1, hs1 >, c1)
  exdistrv(hs2, hs3, (< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2 ∧ hs2 ∈ c1), (< s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3 ∧ hs3 ∈ c1))
  exlimivv(hs2, hs3, ((< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2 ∧ hs2 ∈ c1)∧(< s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3 ∧ hs3 ∈ c1)), hs0 = hs1)
  an4s(< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2, hs2 ∈ c1, < s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3, hs3 ∈ c1, hs0 = hs1)
  sylanbr((< s1, hs0 > ∈ hs2 ∧ < s1, hs1 > ∈ hs3), (hs2 ∈ c1 ∧ hs3 ∈ c1), hs0 = hs1, (s1[hs2]hs0 ∧ s1[hs3]hs1))

blocks.name: tfrlem8
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. The domain of ` recs ` is an ordinal. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1994.) (Proof shortened by Alan Sare, 11-Mar-2008.)
blocks.origin:
thm tfrlem8(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- word(cdm(crecs(c0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c0, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)

thm tfrlem8(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ Ord(dom(recs(c0)))
  ⊣ c1 = { s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ On,(s0[Fn]s1 ∧ ∀(s2 ∈ s1,(s0 ` s2)=(c0 `(s0 |` s2)))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
} = {
  mpbir(Ord(dom(recs(c0))), Ord(⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1))}))
  ax-mp(Ord(⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1))}), { hs0 | ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1))} ⊆ On)
  abssi(hs0, con0, ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1)))
  rexlimiv(hs1, c1, hs0 = dom(hs1), hs0 ∈ On)
  syl(hs1 ∈ c1, (hs0 = dom(hs1)→ hs0 ∈ On), dom(hs1)∈ On)
  sylbi(hs1 ∈ c1, dom(hs1)∈ On, ∃(hs0 ∈ On,(hs1[Fn]hs0 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0,(hs1 ` hs2)=(c0 `(hs1 |` hs2))))))
  abeq2i(hs1, c1, ∃(hs0 ∈ On,(hs1[Fn]hs0 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0,(hs1 ` hs2)=(c0 `(hs1 |` hs2))))))
  tfrlem3(hs1, hs0, hs2, s0, s1, s2, c1, c0)
  rexlimiv(hs0, con0, (hs1[Fn]hs0 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0,(hs1 ` hs2)=(c0 `(hs1 |` hs2)))), dom(hs1)∈ On)
  biimprcd(hs0 ∈ On, (hs1[Fn]hs0 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0,(hs1 ` hs2)=(c0 `(hs1 |` hs2)))), dom(hs1)∈ On)
  eleq1d(dom(hs1), con0, hs0, (hs1[Fn]hs0 ∧ ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0,(hs1 ` hs2)=(c0 `(hs1 |` hs2)))))
  adantr(hs1[Fn]hs0, ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0,(hs1 ` hs2)=(c0 `(hs1 |` hs2))), dom(hs1)= hs0)
  fndm(hs1, hs0)
  eleq1a(dom(hs1), con0, hs0)
  ssorduni({ hs0 | ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1))})
  ax-mp((Ord(dom(recs(c0)))↔ Ord(⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1))})), dom(recs(c0))= ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1))})
  3eqtri(dom(recs(c0)), ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1))}, dom(⋃ c1), ⋃(hs1 ∈ c1, dom(hs1)))
  dmeqi(recs(c0), ⋃ c1)
  recsfval(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  dmuni(hs1, c1)
  dfiun2(hs1, hs0, c1, dom(hs1))
  dmex(hs1)
  vex(hs1)
  ordeq(dom(recs(c0)), ⋃ { hs0 | ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 = dom(hs1))})
  diff.hs0.c(con0)
  diff.hs1.w(hs0 ∈ On)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)
  diff.hs1.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)
  diff.hs2.s(s0)
  diff.hs2.s(s1)
  diff.hs2.s(s2)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(dom(hs1)∈ On)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(dom(hs1))
}

blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. Here we compute the value of ` recs ` (the union of all acceptable functions). (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-1994.)

blocks.name: tfrlem9a
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. Without using ~ ax-rep , show that all the restrictions of ` recs ` are sets. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.)

thm tfrlem9a(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wcel(cres(crecs(c1), c0), universe))
  -| wceq(c2, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wcel(cres(crecs(c1), c0), universe)), diffsc(s0, c0))
  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wcel(cres(crecs(c1), c0), universe)), diffsc(s1, c0))

  mpan(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wcel(cop(c0, cfv(crecs(c1), c0)), crecs(c1)), wfun(crecs(c1)))
  funfvop(crecs(c1), c0)

  eleq2i(cop(c0, cfv(crecs(c1), c0)), crecs(c1), cuni(c2))

  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wa(wcel(cop(c0, cfv(crecs(c1), c0)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wrex(hs1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))))), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  simprr(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wcel(cop(c0, cfv(crecs(c1), c0)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  tfrlem3a(hs1, hs2, s0, s1, s2, cv(hs0), c2, c1)
  rexlimdva(hs1, con0, wa(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wa(wcel(cop(c0, cfv(crecs(c1), c0)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wa(wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)))))), wcel(cres(crecs(c1), c0), universe))
  adantrd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wa(wcel(cop(c0, cfv(crecs(c1), c0)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wcel(cv(hs1), con0)), wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wral(hs2, cv(hs1), wceq(cfv(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(hs0), cv(hs2))))), wcel(cres(crecs(c1), c0), universe))

  syl3anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cdm(crecs(c1))), wa(wcel(cop(c0, cfv(crecs(c1), c0)), cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), con0), wfn(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wceq(cres(crecs(c1), c0), cres(cv(hs0), c0)), wfun(crecs(c1)), wss(cv(hs0), crecs(c1)), wss(c0, cdm(cv(hs0))))

blocks.name: tfrlem10
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. We define class ` C ` by extending ` recs ` with one ordered pair. We will assume, falsely, that domain of ` recs ` is a member of, and thus not equal to, ` On ` . Using this assumption we will prove facts about ` C ` that will lead to a contradiction in ~ tfrlem14 , thus showing the domain of ` recs ` does in fact equal ` On ` . Here we show (under the false assumption) that ` C ` is a function extending the domain of ` recs ( F ) ` by one. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2015.)

  syl(wa(wcel(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0), wceq(c1, cdm(crecs(c0)))), wcel(cop(c1, cfv(c0, cres(c2, c1))), cun(crecs(c0), csn(cop(cdm(crecs(c0)), cfv(c0, crecs(c0)))))), wcel(cop(c1, cfv(c0, cres(c2, c1))), csn(cop(cdm(crecs(c0)), cfv(c0, crecs(c0))))))
  syl5eleq(cop(c1, cfv(c0, cres(c2, c1))), csn(cop(cdm(crecs(c0)), cfv(c0, crecs(c0)))), csn(cop(c1, cfv(c0, cres(c2, c1)))), wa(wcel(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0), wceq(c1, cdm(crecs(c0)))))
  snid(cop(c1, cfv(c0, cres(c2, c1))))

  syl2an(wcel(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0), wceq(c1, cdm(crecs(c0))), wceq(cres(c2, c1), cres(crecs(c0), c1)), wfun(c2), wss(c1, cdm(crecs(c0))))

  ⊢ (dom(recs(c0))∈ On →(c1 ∈ suc(dom(recs(c0)))→(c2 ` c1)=(c0 `(c2 |` c1))))

  ⊣ c2 =(recs(c0)⋃ { < dom(recs(c0)),(c0 ` recs(c0))> })

  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c2)
} = {
  syl5(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, c1 ∈ suc(dom(recs(c0))), (c2 ` c1)=(c0 `(c2 |` c1)), (c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0))∨ c1 = dom(recs(c0))))

  pm2.43d(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0)), (c2 ` c1)=(c0 `(c2 |` c1)))
  pm2.43i(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, (c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0))→(c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0))→(c2 ` c1)=(c0 `(c2 |` c1)))))

  mpanl2(Fun(c2), (dom(recs(c0))∈ On ∧ c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0))), (c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0))→(c2 ` c1)=(c0 `(c2 |` c1))), recs(c0)⊆ c2)
  syl5ibr(((Fun(c2)∧ recs(c0)⊆ c2)∧(dom(recs(c0))∈ On ∧ c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0)))), c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0)), (c2 ` c1)=(c0 `(c2 |` c1)), (recs(c0)` c1)=(c0 `(recs(c0)|` c1)))
  tfrlem9(s0, s1, s2, c1, c0, c3)
  eqeq12d((c2 ` c1), (c0 `(c2 |` c1)), (recs(c0)` c1), (c0 `(recs(c0)|` c1)), ((Fun(c2)∧ recs(c0)⊆ c2)∧(dom(recs(c0))∈ On ∧ c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0)))))

  3expa(Fun(c2), recs(c0)⊆ c2, c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0)), (c2 ` c1)=(recs(c0)` c1))
  funssfv(c2, recs(c0), c1)

  imp(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, c1 ∈ dom(recs(c0)), c1 ⊆ dom(recs(c0)))
  onelss(dom(recs(c0)), c1)
  fveq2d(c0, (c2 |` c1), (recs(c0)|` c1), ((Fun(c2)∧ recs(c0)⊆ c2)∧ c1 ⊆ dom(recs(c0))))
  3expa(Fun(c2), recs(c0)⊆ c2, c1 ⊆ dom(recs(c0)), (c2 |` c1)=(recs(c0)|` c1))
  ex(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, c1 = dom(recs(c0)), (c2 ` c1)=(c0 `(c2 |` c1)))

  adantl(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, c1 = dom(recs(c0)), < c1,(c0 `(c2 |` c1))> = < dom(recs(c0)),(c0 `(c2 |` c1))>)

  eqtrd((c2 |` c1), recs(c0), (recs(c0)|` c1), (dom(recs(c0))∈ On ∧ c1 = dom(recs(c0))))
  syl2an(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, c1 = dom(recs(c0)), (c2 |` c1)=(recs(c0)|` c1), Fun(c2), c1 ⊆ dom(recs(c0)))
  syl(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, Fun(c2), c2[Fn]suc(dom(recs(c0))))
  fnfun(c2, suc(dom(recs(c0))))

  sseqtr4i(recs(c0), c2, (recs(c0)⋃ { < dom(recs(c0)),(c0 ` recs(c0))> }))

  syl6eq((recs(c0)|` c1), recs(c0), (recs(c0)|` dom(recs(c0))), c1 = dom(recs(c0)))
  reseq2(c1, dom(recs(c0)), recs(c0))
  ax-mp((recs(c0)|` dom(recs(c0)))= recs(c0), Rel(recs(c0)))
  tfrlem6(s0, s1, s2, c0, c3)

  syl2an2r(dom(recs(c0))∈ On, c1 = dom(recs(c0)), ((c2 ` c1)=(c0 `(c2 |` c1))↔ < c1,(c0 `(c2 |` c1))> ∈ c2), c2[Fn]suc(dom(recs(c0))), c1 ∈ suc(dom(recs(c0))))

blocks.name: tfrlem13
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. If ` recs ` is a set function, then ` C ` is acceptable, and thus a subset of ` recs ` , but ` dom C ` is bigger than ` dom recs ` . This is a contradiction, so ` recs ` must be a proper class function. (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-Nov-2014.)

  |- wn(wcel(crecs(c0), universe))
  -| wceq(c1, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c0, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
} = {
  mto(wcel(crecs(c0), universe), wcel(cdm(crecs(c0)), cdm(crecs(c0))))

blocks.name: tfrlem14
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. Assuming ~ ax-rep , ` dom recs e. _V <-> recs e. _V ` , so since ` dom recs ` is an ordinal, it must be equal to ` On ` . (Contributed by NM, 14-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm tfrlem14(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wceq(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0)
  -| wceq(c1, cab(s0, wrex(s1, con0, wa(wfn(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wral(s2, cv(s1), wceq(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cfv(c0, cres(cv(s0), cv(s2)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
} = {
  mtpor(wceq(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0), wcel(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0))
  mto(wcel(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0), wcel(crecs(c0), universe))
  tfrlem13(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  mpan(wcel(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0), wcel(crecs(c0), universe), wfun(crecs(c0)))
  tfrlem7(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  funex(crecs(c0), con0)
  mpbi(wo(wcel(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0), wceq(cdm(crecs(c0)), con0)), word(cdm(crecs(c0))))
  tfrlem8(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  ordeleqon(cdm(crecs(c0)))
}

  ⊢ dom(recs(c0))= On

  ⊣ d(s0, s1)

blocks.name: tfrlem15
blocks.content: Lemma for transfinite recursion. Without assuming ~ ax-rep , we can show that all proper initial subsets of ` recs ` are sets, while nothing larger is a set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Nov-2014.)

thm tfrlem15(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {

thm tfrlem15(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ On →(c0 ∈ dom(recs(c1))↔(recs(c1)|` c0)∈ 𝕌))

  reseq2d(crecs(c0), cdm(crecs(c0)), cun(cv(hs0), csn(cv(hs0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wceq(cdm(crecs(c0)), csuc(cv(hs0)))))
  syl6eq(cdm(crecs(c0)), cun(cv(hs0), csn(cv(hs0))), csuc(cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wceq(cdm(crecs(c0)), csuc(cv(hs0)))))
  df-suc(cv(hs0))
  ax-mp(wceq(cres(crecs(c0), cdm(crecs(c0))), crecs(c0)), wrel(crecs(c0)))
  tfrlem6(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  resdm(crecs(c0))
  resundi(crecs(c0), cv(hs0), csn(cv(hs0)))
  sylancl(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wceq(cdm(crecs(c0)), csuc(cv(hs0)))), wcel(cun(cres(crecs(c0), cv(hs0)), cres(crecs(c0), csn(cv(hs0)))), universe), wcel(cres(crecs(c0), cv(hs0)), universe), wcel(cres(crecs(c0), csn(cv(hs0))), universe))
  syl(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wceq(cdm(crecs(c0)), csuc(cv(hs0)))), wcel(cres(crecs(c0), cv(hs0)), universe), wcel(cv(hs0), cdm(crecs(c0))))
  syl5eleqr(cv(hs0), cdm(crecs(c0)), csuc(cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), con0), wceq(cdm(crecs(c0)), csuc(cv(hs0)))))

thm tfrlem16(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ Lim(dom(recs(c0)))
  ⊣ c1 = { s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ On,(s0[Fn]s1 ∧ ∀(s2 ∈ s1,(s0 ` s2)=(c0 `(s0 |` s2)))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
} = {
  ax-mp(Lim(dom(recs(c0))), (dom(recs(c0))= ∅ ∨ ∃(hs0 ∈ On, dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0))∨ Lim(dom(recs(c0)))))
  mpbi((dom(recs(c0))= ∅ ∨ ∃(hs0 ∈ On, dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0))∨ Lim(dom(recs(c0)))), Ord(dom(recs(c0))))
  tfrlem8(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  ordzsl(hs0, dom(recs(c0)))
  3jaoi(dom(recs(c0))= ∅, ∃(hs0 ∈ On, dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)), Lim(dom(recs(c0))), Lim(dom(recs(c0))))
  pm2.21i(dom(recs(c0))= ∅, Lim(dom(recs(c0))))
  n0ii(dom(recs(c0)), emptycls)
  mpbir(∅ ∈ dom(recs(c0)), (recs(c0)|` ∅)∈ 𝕌)
  eqeltri((recs(c0)|` ∅), universe, emptycls)
  res0(recs(c0))
  0ex()
  ax-mp((∅ ∈ dom(recs(c0))↔(recs(c0)|` ∅)∈ 𝕌), ∅ ∈ On)
  0elon()
  tfrlem15(s0, s1, s2, emptycls, c0, c1)
  pm2.21i(∃(hs0 ∈ On, dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)), Lim(dom(recs(c0))))
  mto(∃(hs0 ∈ On, dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)), recs(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  tfrlem13(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  rexlimiva(hs0, con0, dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0), recs(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  eqeltrd(recs(c0), universe, ((recs(c0)|` hs0)⋃(recs(c0)|` { hs0 })), (hs0 ∈ On ∧ dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)))
  3eqtr3g(recs(c0), ((recs(c0)|` hs0)⋃(recs(c0)|` { hs0 })), (recs(c0)|` dom(recs(c0))), (recs(c0)|`(hs0 ⋃ { hs0 })), (hs0 ∈ On ∧ dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)))
  reseq2d(recs(c0), dom(recs(c0)), (hs0 ⋃ { hs0 }), (hs0 ∈ On ∧ dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)))
  syl6eq(dom(recs(c0)), (hs0 ⋃ { hs0 }), suc(hs0), (hs0 ∈ On ∧ dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)))
  df-suc(hs0)
  ax-mp((recs(c0)|` dom(recs(c0)))= recs(c0), Rel(recs(c0)))
  tfrlem6(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  resdm(recs(c0))
  resundi(recs(c0), hs0, { hs0 })
  sylancl((hs0 ∈ On ∧ dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)), ((recs(c0)|` hs0)⋃(recs(c0)|` { hs0 }))∈ 𝕌, (recs(c0)|` hs0)∈ 𝕌, (recs(c0)|` { hs0 })∈ 𝕌)
  syl((hs0 ∈ On ∧ dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)), (recs(c0)|` hs0)∈ 𝕌, hs0 ∈ dom(recs(c0)))
  syl5eleqr(hs0, dom(recs(c0)), suc(hs0), (hs0 ∈ On ∧ dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0)))
  sucid(hs0)
  vex(hs0)
  simpr(hs0 ∈ On, dom(recs(c0))= suc(hs0))
  tfrlem9a(s0, s1, s2, hs0, c0, c1)
  ssexi((recs(c0)|` { hs0 }), { < hs0,(recs(c0)` hs0)> })
  snex(< hs0,(recs(c0)` hs0)>)
  ax-mp((recs(c0)|` { hs0 })⊆ { < hs0,(recs(c0)` hs0)> }, Fun(recs(c0)))
  tfrlem7(s0, s1, s2, c0, c1)
  funressn(recs(c0), hs0)
  unexg((recs(c0)|` hs0), universe, (recs(c0)|` { hs0 }), universe)
  id(Lim(dom(recs(c0))))
  diff.hs0.c(dom(recs(c0)))
  diff.emptycls.s(s0)
  diff.emptycls.s(s1)
  diff.emptycls.s(s2)
  diff.hs0.w(recs(c0)∈ 𝕌)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)

  funeqi(c0, crecs(c1))
  mpbir(wlim(cdm(c0)), wlim(cdm(crecs(c1))))
  tfrlem16(hs2, hs0, hs1, c1, cab(hs2, wrex(hs0, con0, wa(wfn(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wceq(cfv(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))))))))
  eqid(cab(hs2, wrex(hs0, con0, wa(wfn(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), wral(hs1, cv(hs0), wceq(cfv(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)), cfv(c1, cres(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)))))))))
  ax-mp(wb(wlim(cdm(c0)), wlim(cdm(crecs(c1)))), wceq(cdm(c0), cdm(crecs(c1))))

  limeq(cdm(c0), cdm(crecs(c1)))

blocks.name: tfr1
blocks.content: Principle of Transfinite Recursion, part 1 of 3. Theorem 7.41(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 47. We start with an arbitrary class ` G ` , normally a function, and define a class ` A ` of all "acceptable" functions. The final function we're interested in is the union ` F = recs ( G ) ` of them. ` F ` is then said to be defined by transfinite recursion. The purpose of the 3 parts of this theorem is to demonstrate properties of ` F ` . In this first part we show that ` F ` is a function whose domain is all ordinal numbers. (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jan-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm tfr1(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wfn(c0, con0)
  -| wceq(c0, crecs(c1))
} = {
  mpbir(wfn(c0, con0), wfn(crecs(c1), con0))

blocks.name: tfr2
blocks.content: Principle of Transfinite Recursion, part 2 of 3. Theorem 7.41(2) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 47. Here we show that the function ` F ` has the property that for any function ` G ` whatsoever, the "next" value of ` F ` is ` G ` recursively applied to all "previous" values of ` F ` . (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-1995.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 18-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: tfr3
blocks.content: Principle of Transfinite Recursion, part 3 of 3. Theorem 7.41(3) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 47. Finally, we show that ` F ` is unique. We do this by showing that any class ` B ` with the same properties of ` F ` that we showed in parts 1 and 2 is identical to ` F ` . (Contributed by NM, 18-Aug-1994.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2015.)
